intro: Randia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually white or pale yellow, while the fruit is a distinctive, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds.
